user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of alloc:
```c
static int alloc(void)
{
	void *ptr;

	ptr = metal_allocate_memory(1000);
	if (!ptr) {
		metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "failed to allocate memory\n");
		return errno;
	}

	metal_free_memory(ptr);

	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "failed to allocate memory\n");
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: this line calls metal_log, not alloc, and there is no evidence of a call cycle. A violation would occur if metal_log (or any function it calls) invoked alloc (e.g. alloc -> metal_log -> ... -> alloc), creating an indirect recursive call back to alloc.
